item.description: I don‚Äôt know what to think about Microsoft buying GitHub. Should I be happy? Concerned? Thinking about moving all my repos to Bitbucket or self-hosted GitLab?
I‚Äôve never seen two extension ladders leaned up against each other to make one really tall ladder. I hope no one gets hurt!
The next step I want to take is generating the feeds. I want to make full text and microblog versions, with RSS and JSONFeed variants of each.

I‚Äôve started working on my own blog engine. It‚Äôs powered by Vapor 3 and will play nice with short and long-form content. I‚Äôve made pretty good progress in a week. Check it out if you‚Äôre interested. (Full blog post coming when it‚Äôs actually powering my site)

Netflix should release ‚ÄúVHS Mode‚Äù, where watching the same content over and over and over again would degrade the picture over time and eventually snap the tape.

I say this as a parent of boys who are currently on their 1,432nd viewing of the Sarah and Duck show. Make it stop!
A 104.5 temperature is high, right?

This is completely wild. I have an iPhone that‚Äôs tethered to my laptop. My laptop is creating a wireless network, which the phone is joined to. And I‚Äôm still able to proxy my phone through the laptop using Charles. How does this voodoo work??

ü§Ø
I should have done just a little more digging before posting, and I would have found this great library that uses cmark under the hood.
I want to take some Markdown text and convert it to HTML, on Linux and calling it from a Vapor 3 project written in Swift. How would I go about doing this?
I don‚Äôt know much about hockey. But I‚Äôm watching the first game of the Stanley Cup Finals and the score is currently 5-4. Isn‚Äôt that really high?
Dang, I thought I had my Swift Playground woes fixed in Xcode 9.3.1. But alas, I‚Äôm getting the never ending running with this one. I‚Äôm just trying to parse a text file!
Note to self: instead of tweeting about a crazy linter rule at work, petition to have it changed. Make the codebase better rather than whine about it on the interwebs.

I got recommended to try Caddy instead of nginx. I think I have a setup starting to work, but need to figure out how to proxy something from one container to the machine‚Äôs localhost, and have that display using the machine‚Äôs port.
1Password v7 for the Mac is out today! You should go get it. I‚Äôve been on the beta for a while now and it‚Äôs fantastic.
Madness is not being able to find out how nginx is serving localhost:8080 when it‚Äôs not running and nothing is bound to port 8080.

I‚Äôm going to call this a successful end to the night: I just got the taphouse.io site running locally in Docker, and could hit it via localhost.

Next is to get it behind nginx locally, which is proving a harder challenge.
New post from jsorge.net: Rebuilding taphouse.io

I may have hit the point of searching out too much documentation and tutorials for Docker. But I‚Äôm nearing the mental place to be able to understand that a container does not always equal a repo. That has been a mental block for me.

Phase 1 of my taphouse.io rewrite accomplished: Vapor is complete!

Next up is Docker, Nginx, and actual hosting on a server at Digital Ocean.

I stumbled upon this amazing resource to help you learn a language or tool in a short amount of time.

It‚Äôs a great reference for getting started on something unfamiliar.

I‚Äôve had to look at the WWDC video for UIPresentationController and trying to wrap my brain around how view controller transitions work, I think I‚Äôve finally got the basics figured out. Thankfully I don‚Äôt have to work with adaptation much yet. Baby steps.

How was your Friday? üôÇ

The money I‚Äôve spent on Fastmail as my email provider is some of the best I‚Äôve spent. I have 3 domains funneling there as well as all of my ‚Äúlegacy‚Äù email (iCloud & Gmail) landing there too. Having only 1 email account setup on all my devices is really great.

Thanks to @twostraws‚Äôs Vapor book I found that I needed to register a middleware to handle stuff in the public folder. Once that was in my images and styles loaded instantly.

üéâüéâüéâ

Back at my Vapor 3 conversion for taphouse.io. I got the leaf errors figured out. üéâ

Next to get my assets linking properly in the Public folder.
The days when I find something to write (even a short journal or microblog post) are days when I feel better. I don‚Äôt know why that is.
I love Ichiro. He‚Äôs probably the only front office guy in baseball who would be out on the field celebrating an extra innings walk off win dresses in full uniform and batting gloves.
I‚Äôm calling it a night. Feeling somewhat defeated by these leaf templates. But I‚Äôll figure it out. Eventually I‚Äôll finish one of these side projects.

I had the site running on Vapor 2 last year. I‚Äôm just trying to update to 3 and the Leaf templating system is throwing errors I didn‚Äôt see before. So I‚Äôve gotta fix those before adapting for Docker. I don‚Äôt expect even full credit at this point.
vapor rum. It could be a long evening. At least the boys upstairs aren‚Äôt screaming anymore.
After 30 minutes of screaming, the boys are in bed, I‚Äôve got an Old Fashioned, and I‚Äôm ready to tackle Vapor 3.

Tonight‚Äôs project after the boys go to bed: Get my taphouse.io site up and running in Vapor 3 on a local Docker container. Extra credit will be given out if I‚Äôm able to also add nginx, and even more credit still if I can get it running on a server. Stay tuned.
Yup. My boys clogged a Froggy Potty.

It‚Äôs getting increasingly common for us to go wake Atticus from nap and find him wearing a shirt for pants, having put his legs through the arms. I wonder if this kid just really wants skinny jeans?!
Thor Ragnarok is an incredibly rewatchable movie. Just so much fun.
Just saw that James Paxton threw a no hitter in Toronto. Way to go Big Maple! Go Mariners!
On the phone with a senior Apple technical support guy and he did screen sharing with my iPhone. Never seen that before, but it‚Äôs pretty cool.
I‚Äôm super sad to learn that Rain Shadow Meats is closing. Our office just moved to Pioneer Square and I was looking forward to getting their wonderful porchetta sandwich from time to time.
I‚Äôm wanting to get into scripting a bit more, and this new trick from Brett Terpstra will be a great way to spin up something new to try out.
New post from jsorge.net: My First Swift Package
Mariners walk off! What a game!

I‚Äôm writing a little thing that will take my markdown files and make them textbundles and want to embed images in the bundle.

Is a regular expression the best way to get any image names from that file?
I just realized I‚Äôve been a 1Password customer for 10 years now. It‚Äôs easily in my pantheon of apps I couldn‚Äôt live without.

Sad day: My Fluid app for GitHub is considered an ‚Äúold browser‚Äù and is starting to break on me. I emailed the developer of Fluid and hope to get a good response, but it hasn‚Äôt been updated in so long that I‚Äôm not optimistic.

Any other good way to silo a web app on the Mac?
Ok, I got the site working locally. Victory! Next would be porting over my Ghost template to Jekyll. That‚Äôs a battle for another day.

I‚Äôm trying to get a Jekyll instance running locally and I keep running into Ruby and Gems issues. I‚Äôve only used Ruby for Cocoapods and the Gems concept is all new to me. Maybe this isn‚Äôt the blog engine for me.
Star Wars in the style of Arrested Development is the video we all need to see today.

Reminder to my future self: setting the delegate property on a UINavigationController subclass doesn‚Äôt always do what I think it will do. In the case of the MFMessageComposeViewController, I needed to set the messageComposeDelegate instead.
New post from jsorge.net: View Controllers Make Crummy Navigators
The only reason it‚Äôs not insane for parents to pick up after their kids day after day after day is that they don‚Äôt expect different results.

I‚Äôm having this really weird and aggravating problem where some Apple Music songs will not play on my iPhone X but they will play on other devices. Hoping Apple‚Äôs support can get to the bottom of it. I‚Äôve restarted the phone a few times to no avail.
